p: To obtain essential oil from oregano, the method described by Białecka-Floriańczyk and Włostowska ( 2007) was followed. Around 30 g of fresh oregano leaves were crumbled, covered with 400 mL of water, and subjected to distillation in a Deryng apparatus (Simax® KAVALIERGLASS, A.S., Prague, Czech Republic) until essential oils were obtained. The chilled distillate was extracted four times using dichloromethane in a separatory funnel, after which water was removed by adding anhydrous magnesium sulfate. The obtained extract was concentrated in a Büchi rotary evaporator model R-205. The solvent was evaporated at a temperature of 30 °C and pressure 540–560 hPa.
